title: Classic Bellini Cocktail Recipe
text: Recipes Global Cuisines European Italian Classic Bellini Cocktail Be the first to rate & review! 2 Photos The Bellini was created in the late 1930s to early 1940s by Guiseppe Cipriani at the legendary Harry's Bar in Venice, a favorite hangout for expats including Ernest Hemingway, Sinclair Lewis, and Orson Welles. The fruity cocktail owes its name and color to Cipriani's fascination with Giovanni Bellini, a 15th-century Venetian artist. Originally prepared with Prosecco and white peach puree, it's perfectly acceptable to use yellow peach puree or prepared peach nectar and/or peach schnapps. Sip and feel sophisticated! Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 2 fluid ounces peach juice 4 fluid ounces chilled sparkling wine 1 tablespoon raspberry juice Directions Pour peach juice into a champagne flute. Slowly pour sparkling wine over peach juice; let sit until liquids have blended, about 1 minute. Pour raspberry juice over champagne mixture. Recipe Tips Purists do not use Champagne to make this cocktail because it can be too flavorful and hide the subtle peach flavor.You can use sparkling water instead of sparkling wine for a non-alcoholic cocktail.
